title.rendered: “You can download the monkey without donating, but everyone with their conscience”

content.rendered:
the world of NFTin which many they invest to have exclusive virtual works, is growing more and more, despite the fact that many people continue to not understand it. For this reason, there are people who, instead of joining the creation or purchase of this crypto art they prefer to make fun of this trend.

That is the case of chocolatean user who makes humor on Twitter using the image of Coco, the Choco Krispies cereal monkey. And, following in the footsteps of his ironic joke tweets, he has decided to make a small joke with the NFTs for a solidarity cause.

“Hello!You want to win this exclusive NFT the monkey of cojones? Well, it’s very simple! “, She has tweeted this Tuesday along with a simple drawing of the character that does not follow the proportions too much and is poorly colored.”All you have to do is donate 5, 10, 20 euros (As much as you can) to any charitable cause that you feel like (your neighborhood food bank, an animal shelter in your city, some NGO that is not a scam, someone who needs help and asks here. You choose!).”

some NGO that are not a scam, someone who needs help and asks here, you choose!) Then you come to this tweet, you give the secondary button and save the image and it is yours.
And if now you don’t even have money for bologna, you keep it, but donate when you can.

– CHOCU (@Chocu_) November 2, 2021

Later, the user explained how to get the NFT in exchange, a method that is simpler than it seems: “You come to this tweet, you right click it and you save the imageAnd it’s already yours.”

So, you raised a question that would come to mind for many: “‘I can save the image and I don’t need to donate‘. Well, there each one with the conscience of him, you will know if you are not plagued by demons of guilt at night. And she is already. And he remembers that only the people save the people.”

Hey Chocu, but how do I know this is an NFT, does it have a blockchain that guarantees
look, it’s an NFT because it’s a shitty drawing done in five minutes made for the sole purpose of moving money, and that’s essentially an NFT.

– CHOCU (@Chocu_) November 2, 2021

In this way, Chocu has proposed a simple exchange for a good cause. But the truth is that the drawing does not comply with the blockchain registry and other characteristics of NFTs, although it has other arguments that demonstrate its ‘authenticity’.

“Look, it’s an NFT because it’s a shitty drawing made in five minutes for the sole purpose of moving moneyand that is, in essence, an NFT”, the tweeter concluded, putting an end to a fun thread that mixes ridicule and solidarity. Now all that remains is to donate, whether the image has been downloaded or not.
